articles.author: Hannah Confino
articles.description: The Israeli ambassador to the United States was quoted saying a deal could transpire within days.
articles.title: Israel moving towards Hezbollah ceasefire but issues remain, spokesperson says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian missiles damaged residential buildings in Ukraine's eastern city of Kharkiv and Odesa in the south, and a blizzard of drones caused temporary power cuts in Mykolaiv region and targeted the capital Kyiv, Ukrainian officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Russian drones, missiles attack Ukraine's east, south and capital

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Emilie Madi
articles.description: The massive Israeli strike hit the densely populated Basta Fawqa neighbourhood just before dawn on Saturday.
articles.title: Deadliest Israeli strike yet on central Beirut leaves gruesome scenes

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea is expanding a key weapons manufacturing complex that assembles a type of short-range missile used by Russia in Ukraine, researchers at a U.S.-based think tank have concluded, based on satellite images.
articles.title: Exclusive: Satellite images suggest North Korea expanding missile plant, researchers say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammed Salem
articles.description: Heavy rains added seasonal winter misery to communities already devastated by 13 months of war.
articles.title: Rainstorms flood tents of Gaza's displaced as Israel steps up strikes

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: A DHL cargo plane crashed near Lithuania’s Vilnius airport on Monday at about 0330 GMT, killing one person and injuring two others, airport, police and firefighter officials told Reuters.
articles.title: One dead, two injured in DHL cargo plane crash near Vilnius airport

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy, America Hernandez
articles.description: French oil major TotalEnergies halted investments into Adani Group, after the Indian ports-to-power conglomerate was engulfed in a crisis over an alleged multi-million-dollar bribery scheme.
articles.title: TotalEnergies pauses funding for Adani Group after bribery charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Scuffles broke out in the Serbian parliament on Monday after opposition legislators raised banners accusing the ruling coalition of trying to shirk responsibility for the collapse of a train station roof that killed 15 people earlier this month.
articles.title: Brawl erupts in Serbian parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Norway's PST security police force said on Monday it had found no grounds to further investigate Norwegian links to the supply of booby-trapped pagers to Hezbollah in Lebanon, which exploded in September killing dozens of people and wounding thousands.
articles.title: Norway drops investigation into suspected links to Lebanon exploding pagers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A man has been charged with a bomb hoax after an incident outside the United States Embassy in London last week, British police said on Monday.
articles.title: Man charged with bomb hoax over incident at U.S. embassy in London, UK police say
